Reviews.Title: “One of the best hotels in San Diego!”
Reviews.Author: gamnpapa
Reviews.Content: My husband attended a conference at this hotel and I joined him What a lovely hotel and staff. The grounds are impeccable with a beautiful pool area. The rooms are very nice and housekeeping were great. The restaurant and bar was open, inviting and the food is good with a very good happy hour menu. The location is superb!!! Lots of shopping, restaurants, coffee shops, costco is just down the street and has a gas station if you have a car. Old town is just a few miles down the freeway which is right around the corner. One of the best restaurants we tried is "Saigon on 5th" which was in the Hillcrest area and the food is amazing. We will stay at this hotel everytime we return to San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Great Conference at This Hotel”
Reviews.Author: lamist
Reviews.Content: I had a really great time staying here for a conference. It was for 3 nights and 4 days. The room was nice and overlooked the pool on the 8th floor. The conference was actually in the hotel and the food and the rooms for the conference were really nice. The pool area is amazing to look at and there were a lot of malls and restaurants close to the hotel. The hotel staff was always friendly and they answered all my questions.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best hotel experiences I have had”
Reviews.Author: jhssi
Reviews.Content: I attended a week-long conference at the hotel; our group was about 400. I must say this was one of my best hotel experiences ever. The staff was very attentive to our every need and went above and beyond to ensure our stay was memorable. I highly recommend this hotel to individuals and groups. I commend the manager and management staff as having spent a career in various management and executive positions I know service that this doesn't just happen. It come from a well-trained and happy staff. Consider this property for you next San Diego stay- they have sufficient rooms and our group required over 15 breakout rooms capable of holding 30 or more attendees- they met this requirement. I was impressed enough that I personally called the property manager to thank her for making the stay memorable,

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with great staff”
Reviews.Author: sargescott
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel about 80 nights in 2011, and so far in 2012 I have stayed here about 25 nights. Without a doubt, the staff is the most helpful and courteous of any hotel I have stayed at. The rooms are very nice. The property is clean. The restaurant serves great food with lots of beer choices on tap. The pool area is also very clean, peaceful, and relaxing. I would stay at this property for any visit in San Diego due to how well the hotel treats their guests. It is also centrally located within close proximity to lots of restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “This is my happy place”
Reviews.Author: Forest20851
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this property from Christmas day 2011 to January 5th 2012 -- a total of 11 days. I had originally reserved a hotel closer to the airport since I traveled out of San Diego every other day, but I was very unhappy with that place's looks. I was lucky to get the Marriott on short notice. With a long stay, you tend to get chatty with the staff. The desk always greeted my when I came in from the front parking lot (I conned the valets into letting me into the prestigious Elite lot in back on two nights). I even got a smile and hello from the bartender after a couple of nights. However, I managed to work my way around boisterous bowl-game guests, beach volley-ball contestants, and charter bus people during my stay. Everyone stayed even-tempered -- even with beer glasses left of window sills and food plates left in the elevator lobbies. And after a couple days, the maid began leaving me extra in-room coffee packs and powdered creamer (I carry my own Splenda). She was sweet, and on my last day, she waved goodbye to me. I can't believe this was my second choice in San Diego. Next extended visit, it will be my first choice.

Reviews.Title: “All Around Average”
Reviews.Author: saraboff
Reviews.Content: This hotel is clean and decent, but a bit dated. Nothing special about it. Stay at the DoubleTree about five minutes away...its nicer, friendlier and they give you warm cookies.

Reviews.Title: “Might be the worst Marriott property to stay if you are a elite member”
Reviews.Author: chicagotraveler9411
Reviews.Content: I am currently staying for 6 nights due to a dermatology convention in town. I could not get rooms closer to the convention center below $350 at the Marriott Marquis or at the gaslamp so I decided to stay here at $160 a night. The room needs renovation and very small by Marriott standards. There is no concierge at this property and although there is a concierge lounge, the variety and quality of food/snacks that are available is poor. The concierge lounge is closed on weekends and usually at other Marriott properties, the hotel will give you a breakfast voucher if you are a platinum member. Well, not at this property. I ordered a simple burger for room service and the food did arrive on time but was cold and not cooked as I ordered. I am usually happy with the Marriott properties due to the consistent level of the properties and the amenities, however unless you have no other options in San Diego, stay away from this one.

Reviews.Title: “If you have to stay in Mission Valley, this is good as any.”
Reviews.Author: Allen W
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel with an inviting lobby, bar and dining area. Rooms were OK. Marriott-sized and -styled. Clean and efficient. Given the convention rate of $159.00/night, not a bad deal. Staff was great - friendly and helpful. Really liked the informal and large bar/dining area. Limited menu but the food was very good, just not too many choices. Observations (as opposed to complaints): Internet was expensive but you did get one small bottle of water per day. No in-room refrigerator, which is a shame as you are right across the street from a Super K. No in-room safe. Closet was OK but you had to close the bathroom door to get into the closet. Meeting space is excellent with a number of options. Parking fees were way out of line ($15/20 self/valet) given the hotel is in the middle of nowhere - as in - you have to drive to do anything include eat outside the hotel. However, as the hotel is a mile from virtually all of San Diego's auto dealers, you could hitchhike down the freeway and get the transportation you need. Wouldn't stay there if you want to see San Diego's tourist sights, would stay there if, as it was in my case, the conference was being held there. Lastly, it is at least worth the trip to the hotel to hear your GPS pronounce "Qualcomm Way."

Reviews.Title: “great site for a meeting”
Reviews.Author: greenthumb25th
Reviews.Content: enjoyed the city view from our balcony, the staff was very friendly and helpful. I loved the pool and spa area, the firepits were charming and so comfortable for chating and relaxing

Reviews.Title: “Great Convention Hotel”
Reviews.Author: jgmeath
Reviews.Content: I was at thee Marriott Mission Valley for a week setting -up and attending a conference. The staff was first-rate. The accommodations were normal. The food service was good but boring; small selection and expensive. And then there were the additional fees; $13/wireless and $15/parking. Ridiculous. I have to say, if the staff had not been exceptional, my ratings would be much lower. I did not meet one staffer who was not cheerful, helpful, proud and accommodating. And, all, from the GM down to the car attendants were happy to have us in there hotel and let us know.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Circle Marriott”
Reviews.Author: DanvilleRuss
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice upscale hotel close to San Diego State University, where my son attends. Yet the hotel is still close to Old Town where you can get a good dinner and walked around and shop the small boutiques. The staff was very friendly and the room was clean and comfortable. Nice lobby and a friendly barkeep. The pool and workout room were also nice. For a decent price we had a very nice stay.

Reviews.Title: “Never thought I would want to be without snow for Xmas, but San Diego was great.”
Reviews.Author: germany1966
Reviews.Content: T-shirts and shorts...wonderful time in California with family.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, clean, and easy”
Reviews.Author: TioP
Reviews.Content: Hotel seemed nicer than typical Marriott. Rooms fairly sized with very comfortable bedding, adequate bathrooms. Ate at restaurant for breakfast one day - buffet meal tasty, although somewhat limited and slightly overpriced. Public areas all clean & appealing - outdoors areas looked very nice, although couldn't use them because of inclement weather. Very convenient location to shopping, restaurants, and places to see and go in San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Review of Marriott Mission Bay, San Diego”
Reviews.Author: nalcorao
Reviews.Content: This was a hotel I stayed at recently during a business trip - great service and location. Fully recommend this property to anyone going there for business or pleasure. I was pleasantly surprise by the quality of the hypo-allergenic rooms as I do suffer from a few allergies. Got a good nights rest every night.

Reviews.Title: “Somewhat Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: Libralady
Reviews.Content: I joined my husband at this hotel as he was completing a conference. The room was adequate with comfortable beds and plenty of storage space. The bathroom consisted of a bath/shower and toilet with the sink outside the bathroom. Unlike many hotels, the vanity area was very small and there was very little room to set out toiletries, especially with two persons using the sink. Housekeeping did a good job of keeping things clean, except for two large black smudges on the draw drapes. The hotel is located very close to the Rio Vista trolley stop which made getting around very convenient. I would also like to recommend a very nice coffee shop about a block and a half away (if you're at the hotel, head toward the plaza with the Sears that will soon be a K-Mart - the coffee shop is in a professional/residential building on the corner, across the street). They have delicious breakfast sandwiches, great coffee and pastries for breakfast, all reasonably priced. They also have free WiFi, which brings me to my major critique of this Marriott. I fail to understand why mid-price hotels, such as Hampton Inn, Holiday Inn Expess, etc., offer free WiFi in the guest rooms, while Marriotts and other upper-end hotels charge, as in this case, $12.95 per day for the privilege of getting connected. They even charge for the two "business center" computers off the lobby, requiring you to swipe your credit card. There is also no free breakfast, and the least expensive cooked item on the hotel restaurant breakfast menu is $14.00. Adding in the parking charge, it just seemed like the guests are being nickled and dimed when they are already paying a premium price for a hotel room. Being with a conference, we didn't pick this hotel, and probably wouldn't return if in the area again.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty standard Marriott property.”
Reviews.Author: Michael D
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here twice in the last month and find the hotel to be a fairly average Marriott property. The rooms are OK, nothing special, but they meet our needs. We had problems with the air conditioning in the rooms on both stays, but got it fixed. The Concierge lounge which we have access to because of me Marriott elite status, was OK on our first visit and closed on our second visit. So on the second visit we were given vouchers to eat free at the breakfast buffet in the hotel restaurant and this buffet was just OK. The next time I visit San Diego we'll stay here because in general it's an OK hotel and the location is close to my business meetings.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient and Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: CountessCorn
Reviews.Content: While not on the ocean, this Marriott is still very convenient to the water as well as downtown, Qualcomm stadium, San Diego State University and is conveneitnet to all the major highways. The hotel itself is very quiet and comfortable. The concierge lounge is a lilttle small but the staff are very accomodating. The rooms are spacious and the room staff are very efficient. The pool is very nice and there are private cabanas. Another nice touch is workout equipment outside the exercise room in the fresh air. Front desk staff is very friendly and efficient. There are a number of places to sit outdoor both in and out of the sun. The rooms are very quiet. Overall a very realxing and comfortable property.

Reviews.Title: “TYPICAL MARRIOTT”
Reviews.Author: canthaveeverything
Reviews.Content: This hotel is really lacking some of that appeal that others have. But would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Don't expect good service in the bar”
Reviews.Author: Retirewell
Reviews.Content: Stayed seven nights for conference. Got a nice room with a view west down the valley. Got brekkie and lunch and tons of snacks for our breaks - all very good. Only complaint is the really poor service in the bar. It seemed that one drink was the limit and food not something the staff was interested in.

Reviews.Title: “Best location and staff”
Reviews.Author: MallorcaJewel
Reviews.Content: We stayed during first week of October and had a great stay. The staff upon check-in was exceptional. Our room was on a high floor as requested; it was large, clean and the bedding was crisp and comfortable. It was also very quiet and so sleep was wonderful. The property is larger than I expected and the outdoor eating areas and pool area were lovely. They have fresh flavored waters in the lobby at all times and it is just refreshing when you come in from a long day out. We had rented a vehicle and it was very easy getting in and out.

Reviews.Title: “Nive hotel and terrific staff!”
Reviews.Author: Taryn-Rick
Reviews.Content: We stayed last weekend for the Chargers game. The location was great... easy walk to the Stadium. You can tell from the exterior that it is an older hotel but from the inside it looks new....very clean and great decor. Our room was beautiful with huge window that soaked our room with sunshine! Beds and bedding are very comfortable. Room is very clean. The staff make the difference though...very friendly...very genuine. They gave us great local restaurant recommendations. Breakfast at the hotel was delicious. Bar and restaurant staff is outstanding. They know how to deliver service.... we felt like we were at home. Congrats to the staff...you are terrific. I am a Silver Elite member because the Marriott hotel chain consistently provides a great experience.

Reviews.Title: “The first (and hopefully only) time I've ever had to move rooms :(”
Reviews.Author: Glendale_Sarah
Reviews.Content: I think I'm a pretty easy going traveler. But when I stayed here for work for 4 nights in July my experience was sort of terrible. After returning from the gym in the morning after my first night's stay, I found that my shower was broken. It only poured out scalding water. So as not to be late for the conference I was attending, I didn't waste time asking why the housekeeping staff hadn't fixed the problem or notified someone before I checked in. Nope, instead, I called the front desk and asked for someone to fix the problem and let me know by phone when it had been fixed. Crisis resolved, right? Nope. I did get a message saying that the problem was fixed in the afternoon. Yay. Right? Nope. Around 10 PM I went to shower before bed and, you guessed it, the shower was still broken. This is the point that I called the front desk and asked to be moved. While I was moved, no one offered to help and I was stuck hauling all my stuff to another room. No one offered any compensation for the trouble and no one apologized for the fact that this pretty significant issue had not been resolved. I tried following up the next day to ask for some sort of observation of this poor customer service and I had a really hard time reaching anyone. I'm a pretty reasonable person and I've never once complained about a hotel experience so the fact that I went to this step really says a lot about how bad the overall experience was. In addition to my experience, several of my colleagues staying at the hotel had some poor interactions with staff, especially at the hotel's restaurant regarding the quality of the food. Based on these experiences, I really wouldn't recommend a trip to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “IMMPECABLE SERVICE!”
Reviews.Author: beach_h20
Reviews.Content: My company just had a huge 5 day meeting at this location. It is a beautiful facility standard to most of the other Marriott’s, but what really set this location apart was the service. It was IMMPECABLE! Their employees were very accommodating, adjusting to our every request with urgency and a huge smile. What really impressed me was how they seamlessly and effortlessly handled an extremely chaotic event. While we were staying at this location San Diego experienced a massive blackout for nearly 12 hours. Without hesitation they had a contingency plan and were ready to serve the entire hotel including all 325+ of my company’s people. They had excellent grilled food, fruits, veggies, cold drinks, etc… They had a back-up generator to manage the essentials (public restrooms, kitchen, 1 elevator, and the flat screen TV for the 1st NFL game of the season!). It also appeared to me that they had extra staff to manage the inconveniences and provided glow sticks for safety. I can tell you that if you are planning an event at this location have no fear; they deliver excellent service under any circumstance! Kudos to Tala and all of the other staff; you should be proud! On another note, the pool and workout area were great as well!!

Reviews.Title: “Family friendly pool”
Reviews.Author: weluvtrvln
Reviews.Content: My family and I enjoyed this hotel. I booked two rooms, one king room and one double room. The rooms were very clean (as they should be). The sinks are outside the bathroom which is kind of motelish but I didn't mind. We loved the balcony! We had a view of the pool. The pool area was loaded with families and at night they played a movie poolside. this is great for families but if you're single or on business you might not get to enjoy the pool. Since we booked early I got a good price with free full breakfast included so book early! The only negative is that not all rooms have a fridge so you must request it! Overall pretty good. I had no problems. Parking is $14 this expected and the closer you are to the city the more you will pay!

Reviews.Title: “Somewhat Disappointing Visit”
Reviews.Author: ksbrownutah
Reviews.Content: I wasn't very impressed by this Marriott property. I arrived early in the afternoon and promptly got a room on the Concierge Level. San Diego was in the middle of a heat wave, but apparently the hotel didn't think to cool down the hallways. I got into my room and it was sweltering, so I turned on the air conditioning. I took a nap and woke up a couple hours later, still sweating. Still uncomfortable. So, I called maintenance and they came up and verified that the air was working and asked me to wait for it to get cooler. I went to dinner and came back and the room was still sweltering. I asked for a different room, which the hotel accommodated. The concierge lounge was a bit outdated, and small. The details in the paint and polish should have been updated a few years ago and the room looked shabby. Otherwise, they had standard concierge lounge fare. Overall, I was pleased with the service, but less than dazzled by the condition of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “a most disappointing Marriott and certainly not on my repeat visit list”
Reviews.Author: SAFARIMAN80
Reviews.Content: Easy to access and well located to city and most major attractions, but a most disappointing Marriott and certainly not on my repeat visit list. Rooms are small as are the bathrooms, and in need of updating - soon! Concierge lounge is also small and uninviting. The patio area and the pool are nice.

Reviews.Title: “Great pool and happy hour, but no free internet”
Reviews.Author: jeffiner52
Reviews.Content: The rooms, lobby, and service were all very nice, and comparable to other Marriott hotels I've stayed at around California. We had no problem checking-in, or with parking. We had one problem (a concierge told us breakfast was free, when it's not, but that was quickly resolved by Marriott). The pool area is very nice. Although the pool's not heated, there is a spa, sauna, and very well-equipped weight room. Plus, there are free hammocks, and these round couches were you can lay out in comfort and relax. There's also a poolside cabana that's available to be rented. One unexpected plus, was the happy hour, which ran for 5 hours (3 in the afternoon, 2 at night), and had $5 drinks and certain $5 menu items, which was great for a cheaper late night snack. The hotel location was also nice, close to major freeways and several malls/restaurant locations. The only downside was the internet. Most hotels now have free wifi, but the hotel charged to use the internet. We paid $5.95 and once we logged off, could not access the unused minutes w/o paying another $5.95.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT customer service!"”
Reviews.Author: Chinua
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Marriott for a friend's wedding...the hotel is not beach adjacent or downtown, it is in a central location near to freeways, no more than 15 minutes from either beach or downtown, and looked like a great place to stay with a one year old. I saw someone complained about the cost of parking...$14 seemed reasonable for San Diego, and depending on when you arrive, there are a large number of available spots a stone's throw from the lobby. We had several problems with the hotel in the realm of cleanliness...it was not that the room was dirty per se, but the wrapper of some inappropriate trash was on the floor in our room (that our baby grabbed and showed to us, luckily before going into his mouth). I brought this to the attention of the front desk, and they apologized, offered us a new room, and provided us a small perk for our troubles. We did not take the new room, as we were unpacked and getting ready for a wedding...so when my wife found a bug in the room the next morning, we were a little frustrated, especially because the front desk did not send someone to deal with it immediately. However, upon the cleaning staff finding out, they took care of the problem immediately and with care and compassion. Later, Brenda, the manager on duty, came by the room to discuss the problem with us, to apologize for everything that had gone wrong with our stay, and to see how she could help. She followed up with email upon our arrival back home, and was a fantastic person to help us. These were not large-scale problems -- scraps of trash won't always get picked up, and bugs happen especially on the coast (though with a small child, any problem can be a large problem) -- but the staff dealt with them as if they were very important and worked to make sure we were pleased with the results of their work and pleased with our stay. I cannot say enough about this team and their hard work!

Reviews.Title: “Broken Toilet Not Fixed”
Reviews.Author: firewatch
Reviews.Content: We were initially impressed with this hotel. The lobby is elegant and airy and the staff was friendly. All of the rooms have balconies, and our view of Mission Valley was photo-worthy. We could also look down into the gorgeous pool area (though we didn’t have time to use it, since we were there for Comic-Con). There are obvious disadvantages: no free internet, and it’s far from the convention center -- but we knew about these before we arrived. We took the trolley to the con the first morning, before we had our badges, and then took the shuttle after that. The trolley is a ten-minute walk away and the shuttle stop is at the back of the hotel, so it wasn’t too inconvenient. The trip was too long to make twice in one day, however -- we just left early in the morning and came back at night to sleep. There's a shopping center a 15-minute walk from the hotel that has both a Costco and a Starbucks. The Costco was great for a quick, cheap dinner -- their pizza is always good. The Starbucks has free Internet. The reason I can’t recommend this hotel is the faulty toilet in our room and the apparent inability of the staff to fix it. We noticed it flushed slowly the first day but didn’t think anything of it until the toilet actually overflowed the next morning, flooding the bathroom. We called the front desk and security came up. He said he could fix and sanitize the bathroom, or we could move to another room. Since we liked the room (on the 12th floor) and the alternative was on the 3rd floor, we opted to stay. Big mistake -- that night the toilet started slowing down and filling up again. It didn’t actually overflow again, but it looked like it was about to, so we told the front desk the next morning. Again they promised to fix it and clean up, but we had anxiety about it overflowing again. We used the bathroom in the lobby instead, our last night. When we checked out the next morning we complained and the receptionist promised to send an engineer up to look at it -- which didn’t help us much. She also offered us a free breakfast, but we’d already eaten. She said she couldn’t offer us any kind of refund because we’d booked through a third party. No other compensation was offered. Also, just in case you're wondering, there isn't a safe or a fridge/mini-bar in the room.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice Hotel in a good location, Clean Rooms, Nice Pool”
Reviews.Author: lluvia17
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for our 12 year anniversary with our 4 year old daughter we had a great time. Check inn was fast and friendly. Stayed on the 8th floor overlooking the pool very nice view from the balcony, the room is good size and was really clean, the bathroom is a nice size. We loved the location is not to busy with traffic, there are some restaurants close by, the pool its big and really nice, on saturday they had movie night next to the pool with free s'mores. Overall we enjoyed our stayed, the only bad thing was that the trash from the hallway of our 8th floor was never taken out and it smelled really bad, oh and no safe box in the room. Is not as fancy like other marriots but its really comfortable. We would be back.

Reviews.Title: “Ahhh!”
Reviews.Author: 4znuf
Reviews.Content: This is a very comfortable, and very clean hotel with a staff dedicated to making your visit the best it possibly can be. The complimentary full breakfast was wonderful...omelets cooked to order, fresh fruit and fresh baked breakfast breads. The nearby walking trails were a very pleasant surprise. The next time we visit San Diego, i know where we'll stay.

Reviews.Title: “BE WARNED! EXTRA EXPENSES!!!”
Reviews.Author: scubaddiction123
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at this hotel. When I arrived I discovered that the parking would be $14 PER DAY! Wi-fi in the room was $13 PER DAY! So, in addition to the cost for the room, I had to pay an additional $27 to be able to park or work from my room. Wi-fi is complimentary in the LOBBY! That does not work for me as I have to spread out papers while I use the computer. Once I discussed the situation with the hotel staff, and explained that I would be cancelling my stay, they did make an effort to get me to stay. They gave me complimentary parking and wi-fi. However, when it came time to check out, my bill included the charges for the wi-fi. I had to argue with the clerk. He was not too nice about it but finally relented and upheld the original agreement. The rooms have no refrigerator or microwave and are BASIC! There was nothing complimentary of any kind. Maybe I was just jaded because I had just stayed at an Embassy where everything is complimentary and the staff are more than willing to make your stay comfortable but the unexpected parking and wi-fi charges really burned me up. $27 PER DAY!!!!!!!!!! Finally, there are absolutely no attractions nearby (save Friar's Amphitheater) that might account for the expense of this hotel. Its not located next to an amusement park or the beach. There is no reason for the high cost. NONE! One good thing about this hotel, I have to admit, the pool area was gorgeous! But, I will be searching for a hotel that has an extraordinary pool at no unexpected charges. Be warned.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay!”
Reviews.Author: horn2tr
Reviews.Content: This is the second time I have stayed at this hotel. Love the pool area, best in Mission Valley! In this price range, I would stay here every time..................room was clean, small but well appointed, and comfortable. We had a great view of the pool and the surrounding area from our room on the 9th floor. Not very crowded the night we stayed so we were treated to a quiet stay.

Reviews.Title: “Typical excellent Marriott service!!”
Reviews.Author: Edcoach
Reviews.Content: This is an older Marriott but is very nice. The pool area and workout room are excellent and the restaraunt on site is very good. The location is easy to get to and convenient to just about everything. The concierge staff and front desk staff are incredibly nice and go out of their way to help. We had a larger room on top floor which was incredible but I can't speak for the other rooms. There is a charge to park but if you are a Marriott Elite member you get your own parking lot and hotel entrance which is pretty cool.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, convenient location.”
Reviews.Author: MJohnson71
Reviews.Content: Arrived for my conference the day before it began. Took car serve-GreenRide from the airport to the hotel-$23 CASH before tip, well worth the money. Called them from the plane, then again after I got my luggage, no wait @ all. Short drive from the airport to the hotel-very nice hotel. Check in went smoothly, they gave me a room on the 11th floor. had double beds and had requested a king but it was OK since I traveled solo. I just used the other bed to lay out my cloths :). Trolley stop located almost directly behind the hotel-great to get you downtown. You do have to transfer to another line-blue from the green but is very easy and people are kind enough to point you in the right direction should you need help. I arrived on opening day for the Padres, people really love baseball in San Diego, so the tram was a little crowded but nothing a New Yorker can't handle. The rooms are a little dated-desk, chair, rug but everything was clean and they have a fridge and flat screen TV (although I didn't watch it much). Conference rooms were good-cold but that's normal. Didn't have to pay for parking until Friday due to the conference and got my internet fees waived again due to the conference. I would definitely stay here again if I make it back to San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Does what it says on the tin”
Reviews.Author: Mactoki
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a few nights while at a conference at the hotel. Nothing memorable about this place. It's nice enough but a little out of date maybe. The gym has a good selection of free weights and the conference facilities are good. The area sucks, nothing much going on.

Reviews.Title: “This was a very nice hotel.”
Reviews.Author: deannaTucson
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed my stay at this hotel. This hotel was an excellent value for $89 per night. I do not like to pay to park and it does cost 12.00 per day. The rooms were very nice. The hotel was very clean. I would stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Great Location for Conference”
Reviews.Author: EricLosAngeles
Reviews.Content: Nice rooms, good location, excellent conference facilities. Staff was very friendly. Only downside is the outrageous internet access charges!!

Reviews.Title: “Not up to Usual Marriott Standard”
Reviews.Author: Antony T
Reviews.Content: The hotel seems a bit outdated to me and could do with being a bit more airy. Also from the pool area (which I did not go in) it seems very motel-ish; not typical of a Marriott. Service was OK, but it was not people going out of their way to help as is normally the case at other Marriott properties. The best thing this hotel has going for it is the fact that it is adjacent to a San Diego Trolley stop, so even without a car it is easy to get all over town. Even if you have a car like I did, it is still handy for those times when maybe you want to go to a bar and not drive. There are plenty of big shops and take out places within walking distance and a bigger mall a couple of stops away on the trolley. You can take the trolley all the way to the Mexican border! The only place I drove to was Coronado (not served by the trolley) and one night I headed to a casino in the canyons. Below Marriott standard; but great place to stay if you do not have a car.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: megawhizz
Reviews.Content: Although the location is somewhat isolated, away from the happening parts of town, this is a nice comfortable hotel with good service. The in-hotel restaurant is okay, though the bar area is nice food quality is just okay. Everything tasted kinda bland. I didn't use the pool though it appeared nice, hotel room was comfortable clean and quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Retro rooms”
Reviews.Author: FlytheTail
Reviews.Content: I spent 2 nights at this hotel. The lobby and common areas were nice, exercise equipment were adequate, etc. However, the rooms were really dated. The turquoise blue carpet, pink office chair, and red & gold drapes looked like the room hadn't been decorated since the '80s. Only cable internet was available in the room. No restaurants were within close walking distance, so you either need a car or have to eat in the hotel. This wasn't a bad hotel, but it didn't live up to the standards of the Marriott name.

Reviews.Title: “BEWARE OF THEIFS IN THE HOTEL'S PARKING!”
Reviews.Author: Michel034
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the hotel for 3 nights. Parked my car using your Valet service. On 8/14 morning, I received a phone call from one of your staff, notifying that during the night a robbery occurred in your parking lot. The front passenger window was broken and the GPS sistem was stolen. After claiming the damage done to the car and to the GPS to the hotel manager at the moment, I was informed that niether Ace (their parking operator) nor the hotel were responsible for the robary (!) and that I should contact the rental company. I received a small brochure from ACE Parking, explaining I should write an official claim ... I was surprised to learn that, even though I used the Valet parking system, ACE and the Hotel did not want to take any responsibility to the robbery that happened in their facilities! I spent most of that 8/14 day reviewing the situation with the hotel staff, calling my US Insurance agent, filling the official claim at the rental company, waiting for a car replacement (which was not available) and, eventually, downgrading my rental to a smaller car. I had to rearange our tight schedule, cancelling several activities (we travelled to California from Mexico City and planned to be in SD for 2 days only), all because of the hotel parking robbery incident. As I finished the rental period on 8/16, I had to pay and extra $318US for the stolen GPS system. As you can see, the robbery that occured in your hotel, had cost me considerable time and money, as well as disturbing my mood and plans during our short stay. As a business man, I travel and use Marriott hotels constantly. I expeceted both Marriott and Ace to take into consideration such loyalty, through a reimbersment for the time and money lost during our SD CA stay....

Reviews.Title: “AVOID THIS MARRIOTT IF YOU NEED GOOD INTERNET ACCESS”
Reviews.Author: CarolMaeRay
Reviews.Content: When the tour I took sent me the hotel information I was quite happy. Marriotts are clean, upscale, and modern in their approach to technology and traveler's needs. This Marriott had THE WORST wireless internet speed I have ever experienced. My days with 56k telephone dial up over 15 years ago were far superior to this Marriott's so-called internet access. I complained once in the morning and was told "we will call our engineer" then once again at night and was given the same lame answer, "we will call our engineer." I had to give up using the laptop and depend on the Blackberry for the rest of my stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Am I in 1980 or 2011?”
Reviews.Author: dljhk
Reviews.Content: This hotel still looks like and operates like it was in 1980. No wifi outside of the lobby and convention space. No safes on room. Very basic for a full service Marriott Not a good hotel for a convention. Poorly laid out space. Outdoor Pavillion is largest space. No imagination on banquet menus. Same lunch each day with different meats. Desserts all look alike no matter what you have.

Reviews.Title: “Traditional Marriott - Great service, clean but nothing exceptional”
Reviews.Author: PennStateFan
Reviews.Content: I would have loved to rate this property 4 1/2 because it was everything you'd come to expect with Marriott - the only slight ding is it's your normal Marriott property with nothing exceptional. We did a one night stay over Christmas with the family (two adults and an 8 and 5 year old). I am a platinum Marriott Rewards member but I don't think it got me anything special other than free breakfast. Check in - smooth and easy. I don't think the hotel was that busy and there was no wait. I did ask to be moved to a room with a sofa bed and they did that quickly. Room - The room was a standard king room with pull out sofa. It's more than enough space with 2 people in a room, but with the sofa bed pulled out, it was really tight (I do expect it since it's a normal room, but just mentioning to others traveling with kids to plan accordingly). Bed was comfortable and nice flat screen TV with plenty of movies. I was on the 16th floor. Small fridge and microwave was under the TV. The sink/vanity was separate from the bath/toilet which is a nice plus. Concierge Lounge - As platinum, usually get lounge access but was closed over the holiday week. Did get two free appetizers and two free buffet breakfast certificates so that was nice. I did miss my free diet Pepsi's though :) Parking - the parking was like $13 for self parking. There was plenty of space and there is a valet option too. Restaurant/bar - We stopped in for a late night snack with the free appetizers and the wife had a salad. Again, very typical of the Marriott restaurants. Small menu but different variety and about the price you'd expect at a hotel. Quality was fine but nothing over the top. The breakfast buffet was nice. Egg station and the rest of the normal things (bacon, sausage, fruit, yogurt, waffles, danish, toast, etc. It was nice that I get it free and the kids got theirs free too (not sure what the age break is, but breakfast is free with "paying" adult for the kids). Amenities - We didn't do anything but eat and sleep so don't know about the pool or workout room. There is a shot that has souvenirs and basic snacks and amenities. I would recommend this hotel to business people or families traveling. If you've stay at Marriott's often, you'll see this is very similar to most. Great service, clean, functional. Only minor cons were size of room (again, typical size, but kids take up space) and nothing different or unique that pushes it over the top.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it! Highly Recommended”
Reviews.Author: fh1342
Reviews.Content: Stayed here to watch the Giants play the Padres, and I really enjoyed my stay here. I stayed on the 7th floor the room was very clean and spacious. The lobby seemed to be remodeled and everything looked quite nice.. I would definately stay here again. THe only minus is the parking fee, but you can't win them all.

Reviews.Title: “I was torn about this Marriott, because...”
Reviews.Author: brmusicman
Reviews.Content: I was torn about this Marriott, because the rooms were not as nice as I have experienced at other Marriotts. However, the service and other ammenities helped to redeem the stay. The rooms had the standard stuff (including the fabulous Marriott bed); there was nothing gross or wrong about them per se. However, they were on the smallish side and lacked some of the upgraded features I have found at other Marriott hotels, including upgraded lighting, ways to connect the television to your computer, and a flexible working area. Worst of all, though, was the total lack of outlets near the desk: to plug in my laptop I had to dive under the desk and plug into a wall outlet that had a 3-outlet extender in it that had only one open space. That said, the hotel had some great features- a nice pool area, a great fitness center, and a stylish lobby. Best of all was the concierge lounge, which featured outstanding and friendly service in both the morning and evening, an excellent breakfast, and evening meal service that was enough for dinner. Truly excellent. The front desk service was also excellent, as was the valet service (fast and polite). Location was fine- downtown is more fun, but this was close to where I had business, had easy access to the highway, and had places to eat nearby. Overall, I think the rooms could use an upgrade, but their decent quality combined with superb service made for a solid stay.

Reviews.Title: “rooms needing a facelift”
Reviews.Author: cliu
Reviews.Content: we spent only one night at the marriott mission valley because we paid only $55 on priceline for it and we thought that was a great price. the actual property is quite nice with complimentary washers and dryers, pool, and a fitness room. obviously the hotel is quite old and the rooms and fitness room both reflect the age of the building. i think the hotel could be quite beautiful if they can give it a face lift and do some remodelling. i would say it is a great place to sleep for $55 a night but it is no resort. we saved some $$ by parking on the street instead of at the hotel for $18/night.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: cremebrulee0331
Reviews.Content: So I made a huge mistake for booking rooms at Howard Johnson prior to this, and they turned out to be DISGUSTING. (refer to my other review) So I moved my family to this hotel after canceling our 2nd night at Howard Johnson. Omg, I was so relieved that it brought tears to my eyes. The bedding was actually crispy clean and the floor was clean enough to walk barefooted!! Putting jokes aside, it was a very nice hotel. The hotel/restaurant staff were really friendly. They served really nice breakfast at the restaurant. Overpriced, but that's pretty standard for hotels. The only lame thing was that they charge a lot for parking. If you're lucky you might find a street parking, but don't count on it. Overall, it was a nice hotel stay.

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly central with a car to all attractions in San Diego”
Reviews.Author: Businesskasper82
Reviews.Content: The hotel is perfectly in the the middle of sea world, zoo etc. and downtown as well as to shopping malls; however that requires having a car - btw parking on the street is for free, so you dont need to park it on the hotel lot. The amenities in the hotel are also quite good, a reasonable gym and a quite big pool. Also the breakfast and business lounge are very good; rooms are clean and have typical Marriott standard, so you can sleep very well!

Reviews.Title: “Great experience with this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Travel_Buff_BL
Reviews.Content: I stayed here 3 nights for a business meeting and was very pleased. The room has updated furniture, good beds, and a nice balcony overlooking the pool/fountain. The pool area is really outstanding, with excellent layout and comfortable cushioned furniture. The meeting rooms were ideal, with excellent equipment. And, the staff were outstanding in their service. I was early and my room wasn't ready when I arrived, but they put a rush on it, and 10 minutes later it was ready. The hotel is within walking distance to literally hundreds of shops and restaurants. Also, the tram station is next door, so you can hop it into the downtown and waterfront easily. Good place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “Great Menu, Great Service”
Reviews.Author: ScrapBookMom305
Reviews.Content: We stayed at San Diego Marriott Mission Valley for 4 nights. Ver helpful staff always willing to assist guests. Although they dont have a concierge, pretty much everyone in the hotel can help you make dinner and trip reservations :) The restaurant was very nice too....they have an awesome happy hour!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location for a Wonderful City Visit”
Reviews.Author: peterpanGeorgia
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed a two night stay at the Marriott Mission Valley. The location is fabulous and seems to be in a more upscale part of town. You are close to several restaurants and shopping. It is very close to the expressway that takes you anywhere you need to go in San Diego. The pool area is wonderful with a heated pool with lots of seating and even two hammocks. At night we noticed family friendly movies being shown on a large screen tv as kids swam around in the pool. Employees were even passing out twizzlers to the guest. The fitness center isn't large but does contain several nice pieces of equipment with built in tvs (my favorite kind!). They have complimentary headphones as needed. We were there over the weekend and were given complimentary breakfast passes as the concierge lounge was closed. The breakfast buffet included was delicious with a well stocked buffet with made to order omelets. Our room was on the 15th floor which is a concierge floor. The room included robes, free bottled water, and chocolate at turn down. The hotel is in the process of converting the tvs to flat screens which will be a nice improvement. They were beginning to work on the 15th floor as we were checking out. You'll love your decision to stay at this Marriott!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel and great location!! Horrible beds!”
Reviews.Author: irisrose
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a week at the Marriott Mission Valley while my husband attended a conference. The hotel is quite nice. There were a couple of things in the room that could be changed out to give it an instant update - get rid of the old 19" tv and scuffed up entertainment center for a flat panel on a dresser and the room would look far more updated. Everything else was clean and in good shape. We didn't use the wireless internet because it was kind of costly so I cannot comment on that. Housekeeping was efficient and quick to clean the rooms. The pool is really quite lovely. It was kind of cool when we were there so the pool was usually all ours except for a few sunbathers. Lots of towels, chaise lounges and 3 pretty cabanas with furniture and hammocks. It was clean and well kept and relaxing with the music and large fountain. In the evening there were really yummy rocky road cookies in the lobby. But act fast because it's not an endless supply. Parking was $14 per day but we just parked along the street of the hotel for free with not much further to walk than from areas of the paid parking. Every room has a balcony which is nice to step out on for fresh air or just to look around the area. We faced I-8 but were never disturbed by road noise. We didn't have any trouble with the elevators being too slow. There are only 3 so if the hotel is packed I suppose it could get slow. This hotel is in a great location. It took 20-30 minutes to get to a lot of places we visited. Blocks to the San Diego Zoo, just a few miles from Sea World. We drove up to La Jolla to see the seals and Scripps aquarium and that didn't take long at all to get there. And if you want to go to the beaches, probably 20 minutes to those. And lots of shopping (high end and average) and places to eat. Now onto those beds. Oy! I don't think I've slept on anything as torturous as these beds! Hard and slightly sunken in the middle - and SMALL! They are only double beds! Who even offers double beds anymore? They tried to make them more comfortable with some kind of mattress cover but it fails to resolve the problem of the old, hard mattress. C'mon Marriott! You have a nice property in a great location - fork out a little money to give your customers a comfortable bed to sleep on! Other than that, the hotel was super quiet for sleeping and the rooms pretty spacious.

Reviews.Title: “It is the people that make a hotel and this one has the BEST!”
Reviews.Author: MissouriMisty
Reviews.Content: The hotel staff-from Housekeeping to the General Manager are the nicest and bend over backwards to make your stay an amazing experience! I would not stay in any other chain (only a Marriott property) and it is because of the way I have been treated here.

Reviews.Title: “Great Deal”
Reviews.Author: proibita21
Reviews.Content: I booked my stay throw priceline. I was able to get a rate of 63.00 per night. Location Great, Service Great, Location Great. I loved it. In the lobby they had flavored water ..... very refreshing and tasteful. Well Overall It was a great Hotel

Reviews.Title: “Wedding headquarters”
Reviews.Author: Ralphs
Reviews.Content: We checked in early and the room was ready for our use. The room is large; and clean. The room had a West view to the ocean. A large sliding glass door led to a small balcony. The room was nicely appointed with a minimum of pictures. There is a large lounge chair with ottoman;side table and lamp. A large business type desk had hi-speed business connection; telephone; lamp and coffee and tea. An executive type chair was also provided. The bed was King size and very comfortable. There were many pillows and the comforter was light yet very warm. There are nightstands with lamps on both sides of the bed.Both stands had two drawers. The armoir held a TV, two open slots and a small drawer plus three large drawers and an enclosed refrigerator. The Bath is separate from the sink/dressing table. The usual amentities were present. There is a hair dryer and iron plus ironing board. The closet is large with plenty of hangars and a double mirrored sliding door. The bath towels are large and very soft and absorbent. Plenty of soap;cotton balls;kleenex and q-tips. There is a grab bar in the shower/tub. The shower curtain in curved out which is always good when showering. A comfortable friendly hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location for San Diego Chargers Game-All San Diego Just a Trolley Away”
Reviews.Author: WhirledTravelor
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night when attending a Chargers game. Good price ($100) and close to stadium. You can walk (about 20 minutes) or take trolley which has a station down the street 5 minutes walk away. Probably faster to walk as we had to wait for 3 trolleys until one had room. Anyways, the hotel check in was nice and easy even with early check in. Self parking was $14? a day but close to room. Nice pool and bar area (limited but OK beers on tap) but did not eat at restaurants. Room was small but had a comfortable bed. Old tube style TV in armoire you have to pull and tilt towards bed but fine for the night. Alarm clock, desk/chair. sofa, decent bathroom and a small balcony not big enough to sit on but maybe if you smoke it's OK. Good for fresh air. Called front desk to let them know alarm clock from next door was going off for the last hour. They sent someone up with 5 minutes and called back to make sure it took care of the issue. Very good job. Used free internet and printer in lobby by check-in. Good gift shop. Friendly and helpful staff all over the property. I would say this is a very well managed hotel (as with most Mariott's) but does need upgrades to room and facilities (some small details didn't work like elevator buttons, lights, creaky bar stools etc) soon to be a real 4 star. Overall, for under $125 w/parking and tax I would say this is a good value.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, Great Location, OVERPRICED!”
Reviews.Author: diarmy
Reviews.Content: This is a reasonable hotel for San Diego. Indeed for any city. We stayed for 2 nights midweek while visiting the Zoo and Wild Animal Park. As a base for both, Mission Valley is excellent as it's not downtown and neither is it out in the wilderness. I've stayed in a few Marriott hotels in the past, and regularly visit one for work meetings. I find them to be very dated to the 1990s and sometimes older. The Marriott brand has really done itself no favours with the décor in this or any other hotel. The dated feel permeates throughout leaving the guest with a disheartening feeling as you move through the hotel. The rooms are clean, however very dated. CRT television with very poor quality reception on almost all channels apart from ESPN. The internet usage was included in my rate, but is severely lacking in juice. The 'Wired for Business' LAN network for instance seems to be on a 10 Mbit network, which is a older technology and causes massive latency issues for anyone trying to establish a VPN to their office (especially trans-atlantic ones!). The restaurant is sparsely decorated and poorly laid out. Focus appears to be on the bar rather than the restaurant. However the food is very good. The New York strip is excellent as is the Caesar Salad. Again however, the Marriott's price-point kicks in. The food is very expensive here. Breakfast for example, which is excellent in both service and quality, is very expensive again. Over $40 for 2 people for what could count as a full Irish breakfast with coffee. Overall this is a good hotel to stay at. Given San Diego is plagued by conferences and business meetings from what I've seen and read, hotel prices are expensive as a result. My advice would be to stay perhaps further out, maybe in Escondido or something if you could find a nice hotel. Marriott Mission Valley is an OK hotel, but beware that it is both expensive and dated. I really wouldn't pay for it again, but I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “This Marriott is not the best....”
Reviews.Author: Lisavee
Reviews.Content: The location is great however the rooms are outdated and the hotel is in need of it too. The elevators all do not run and take a long time. The staff are not very courteous...especially the front desk staff. The beds were not only stiff but it made my back ache and I tossed and turned all night. This never happens when I stay with Marriott. The pool is small and not very inviting....and beware the breakfast buffet is the same day in and day out and it is not very good. You are better off ordering off the menu. Not ony was the stay horrible I was very disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: o-grego
Reviews.Content: Clean, comfortable rooms. Trolley station right behind the hotel. A few blocks from In-N-Out (giving you the opportunity to walk off the burger!) One trolley stop from shopping. Several trolley stops and a trolley transfer from downtown (the only downside in the location). Reasonable rates, but even better if you end up with this hotel after bidding on Priceline, as I did. Staff was also very helpful; first, they let me check-in early, and second, they helped me out in receiving messages for me at the front desk. The only downside was having to pay for ethernet internet. I guess it's a Marriott-wide policy: no wireless in the rooms, only ethernet.

Reviews.Title: “Consistantly Exceptional”
Reviews.Author: SimonDeLao
Reviews.Content: After last week’s Harbor Island Hilton fiasco, I came to the Mission Valley Marriott. It is somewhat remote if you are doing business in the city, however, the positives greatly outweigh the location. We requested a very check in (7:00am) - and were accommodated with a smile. When travelling overnight internationally, the last thing we want is a hassle with the hotel staff. My head hit the pillow and I was out within seconds. The amenities were many and the property is very well maintained. We had a working dinner in the restaurant. The food and drink were plentiful, affordable and very tasty. As usual the restaurant staff was knowledgeable and had a keen sense of my special dietary requirements. It is so refreshing to stay at a hotel where you never hear "NO, we can't do that", or "Sorry but our policy states..." Upon check out it was nice to receive our bill that didn't have any bogus "fees" attached. The only downside was the age and noise of the air conditioning unit and the shabbiness of the concierge lounge. I highly recommend this property when staying in San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “great location within San Diego for a great value”
Reviews.Author: cashbox1124
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel due to it's proximity to Qualcomm Staduim (we were in town for a football game). The hotel is about a mile from the Stadium, but the hotel recommended we take the trolley (not because of safety, just out of convienence). I'm very glad we took their advice. The trolley is just across the street from the hotel and runs until midnight during the weekend. It stops every 15 minutes. For $2.50/person/trip (or $5 all day) the trolley will take you all over San Diego, which is a great plus! We left our vehicle at the hotel the following day and took the trolley to Old Town. When we returned, our car was safe in the parking lot. As for the hotel.... It's in a business area, but it is kept very clean and is nearby to shopping and restaurants (if you'd prefer to not eat the hotel restaurant, we did not eat there). There's a beautiful pool (and hot tub) along an amazingly manuicured area. Although we arrived to the hotel early (noon), they were able to give us a room on the 8th floor with a balcony and king-sized bed, overlooking the pool area. Our room also came with a mini-fridge (however, I'm not sure all rooms are equipped with one). There was a nice breeze that came in through the sliding door at the balcony and we slept with the door open to take advantage of the fresh air. At 5pm, they have cookies and milk in the lobby. The front desk is more than happy to help you with directions and ideas (even providing maps) of things to do in the surrounding area. They were the ones that suggested us leaving our car in the parking lot the following day and taking the trolley into downtown and the surrounding areas. The hotel is also very family-friendly. All in all, it was a great stay with very friendly staff. I wouldn't hesitate to stay at this hotel again!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: tgorm1
Reviews.Content: We didn't get to spend much time here since it was a stop over. We got a package deal to include room, parking, movie, and breakfast buffet. Got a good deal considering all that was included. The room was very nice and I slept great. The view was great on the 16th floor of the pool. The breakfast buffet was out of this world!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and breakfast buffet - terrible response to issues”
Reviews.Author: IrvineTraveler22
Reviews.Content: Great location, quieter part of mission valley with restaurants/strip mall within walking distance. Late check in at 10 pm and room reserved as requested (high floor, overlooking pool). Discovered spoiled chinese food in refrigerator that was not included in room package. Odor permeated room. Staff did not offer another room, but sent someone unequipped to remove the refrigerator out of armoire. Unresolved until we called again next day. Still no offer for comparable room or compensation. Beds worn, no support. Elevators broken with only 1 of 3 operating. Nice cookies and strawberry water offered in lobby. Excellent breakfast buffet (complete) with omelet chef and low spread for young children. Pool area very nice with fountain, couches, cabanas with hammocks and extra seating on upper tiers. fitness room good with sauna and a couple of cycling machines outdoors facing the pool. Definitely return if adequate remedy provided for refrigerator mishap. Upon checkout, staff offered comp breakfast - we already enjoyed as part of our package, so that was not an adequate remedy. However, excellent value overall. Breakfast was most enjoyable, especially for young children.

Reviews.Title: “Slept like a baby”
Reviews.Author: Bombero911az
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful hotel with great beds.....just what beds are supposed to be like in a hotel. I really did slleep like a baby. The location was convenient. I was there attending an event at Qualcomm Stadium. The location was so close to the stadium, maybe a mile or less. The main cross streets the hotel is close by is Qualcomm Way and Friars RD. If you stay there for a large event at Qualcomm Stadium, walking will be an alternative to the traffic. I did not use all the facilities ammenities, but I did notice they have an awesome pool. At night, I saw they had events or music, one night there was a lot of activity in the pool with music. The pool is lighted underwater with a cool blue light. Another night, they had a cartoon movie pool side in a large projector type screen for children. Only draw back is that they charge for internet access in the gust rooms. We did not eat at the hotel either but there are plenty of good restaurants nearby. I guess what I can add to the review is that the staff is great and the rooms are definitely good! I would recommend this room to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “Good deal for the price”
Reviews.Author: stcrmora
Reviews.Content: My daughter and her friend had tickets to a concert in San Diego (we are from the LA area). I used price line name your own price and got rooms for $66 dollars which was about 40% less than I could get the room on my own. We arrived at the hotel around 4 pm and were checked in to rooms that were across from one another. The rooms were nice. Ours had a king bed with a sofa and overlooked the pool. My daughters friend and her mothers room had a King bed and a lounge chair. I am not sure if our room was cleaned as thoroughly as would be expected ( I found suspicious spots on the floor in the bathroom. I used a towel and some hand disinfectant and cleaned the floors myself.). The staff was very friendly. Parking was expensive.. 22 plus tips each time you leave. The pool was a nice treat. The service could have been better.. They have water in the lobby in a ceramic jar like at a spa.. but no cups and when I went to get cups from the bar.. I found that the water was empty. We went to the pool at around 10 am and the towels had all been used. However when I called they came and replenished the towels. Someone did come around from the bar to sell drinks. One final thing, one of the elevators was not working which made for long lines at the elevators. Overall for the price my stay was nice.

Reviews.Title: “This Marriott needs some work”
Reviews.Author: walkermn
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this marriott for a business trip in April. When we arrived we were greeted and we got our rooms. I went to mine and the AC was broken. I had to go downstairs to get another room. When I got to my second room it smelled of urine. I went back downstairs and got another room (3rd). The rooms need updating, alot of wear and you can see the age. They do not have WIFI in the rooms, which was very disappointing. The food was very expensive and not worth the money. The hotel is in a good area and close to downtown and attractions. The hotel needs a lot of updating. I would not recommedend the hotel. The next time I travel to San Diego I will be staying at the Hilton or the new Courtyard.

Reviews.Title: “An Okay stay in San Diego”
Reviews.Author: SCalGal
Reviews.Content: Average. The lobby was nice. They are currently updating the bar and restaurant area with a fresh coat of paint. One of the elevators was not operating during our stay, pity as it was a huge water polo tournament and there were kids using them constantly. The rooms: well, they were nice. The beds were "full" not "queen" beds. Quite small for the four of us. The bathroom sink was outside the shower/toilet area and was tiny. The bedding was nice with down comforter and clean white sheets. The crazy blue carpet reminded me of Vegas. This property is older, but they have tried to maintain and keep it up to date. That being said, there was cottage cheese ceiling and the rooms were quite "musty" because of the proximity to the ocean. (I guess) There was a deck/balcony area with no furniture. Probably because the railing was a little low. The view over the pool was nice, the other side over the parking lot would not be very good. There is a great waterfall and pool area. The waterfall is massive and hides the noise of the two main streets outside the hotel. There are great lounge chairs and daybeds to relax on. All very nice. No pool service that I could see. You can get a drink of soda from the bar to take out to the pool for $3.50 or the gift store for $1.50. All in all, I wouldn't go back unless I had to. There are so many choices in San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Service with a Smile”
Reviews.Author: kendrick
Reviews.Content: The purpose of my stay was to attend a conference being held at the hotel. Warmly greeted at the front desk, we were able to check in a few hours early. My room was a spacious and pleasantly appointed double, with a small vanity area and seperate space for the commode and shower. There was a large desk with internet connection, no wireless, altho my laptop was picking up plenty of signals I paid for the secure connection. The only drawback to the room was the view - the parking lot. For the duration of my stay I was greeted with a smile and hello by every employee I interacted with or passed by. It was a very nice touch and I appreciated it. As meetings were scheduled closely together I ate most of my meals in the hotel and was happy with the quality. One morning I had the breakfast buffett and in addition to the coffee I had at the table, the server offered to prepare a to-go cup for me as well. It was most appreciated! The coffee, btw, was really good, not the typical hotel dishwater. The pool area was beautiful, large comfy places to sit along with a few hammocks for real relaxtion. The hot tub was nearby and looked inviting, tho I was not able to indulge. We had a cocktail reception and the passed hors d'ouerves were delicious. There are restaurants nearby which you can walk to, but the hotel is located in a very busy retail/office district and it is not exactly pedestrian-friendly. It was a great place to have a conference, and I would return.

Reviews.Title: “Would definitely return”
Reviews.Author: zingmaster
Reviews.Content: Overall experience was very good. Stayed here for 2 nights and got a good rate on Priceline. The check in process was very smooth and we received an excellent recommendation for dinner that night from Tony at the front desk. We were very impressed by the attention he gave us. The room was clean and it had a nice shower. Had to leave the A/C fan set to "on" rather than "auto" as the first night it drove us nuts going on and off. Very good excercise room with lots of cardio machines and one universal weight machine along with free weights. Pool area looked great but didn't use the pool. Service in the bar was amateurish the one time we went in. Breakfast was good but quite overpriced. We ordered off the menu rather than have the $20 buffet. Still $4 coffee seems steep to me. I wouldn't hesitate to stay here again but probably not at regular rates.

Reviews.Title: “I used to love this place”
Reviews.Author: INFJ
Reviews.Content: It hurts me to write this review, but hopefully someone at Marriott will read it and fix the problems so it will be good again. I mentioned it to the hotel, but it keeps sliding downhill. I love San Diego. Beautiful place. The hotel's location is great. The pool area and exercise room are amazing. The breakfast buffet is not as good as you usually get free at other Marriotts and most comparable hotels it costs about $20 per person. The internet cost $10 a day. The carpets are starting to show stains in the hallways. There are signs of wear everywhere. One of the elevators was broken. The ice machines were broken. (They did offer to bring up ice to my room if I called.) There were long black hairs on our bathroom floor. (We have short, light hair.) But, what bothered me the most was the way housekeeping knocks and then immediately opens my door several times a day. While I'm here, I work from my room during the day. So, I learned to put the double lock on my door. So, it' goes knock, knock, bang. Not one beat between the knocks and the open. I'm right here. A few feet away and they don't give me 2 seconds to get to the door before they come in. Once to bring me extra pillows I did not ask for when I already had eight pillows. Another to clean my room on the day I checked out before 8 a.m. when check out is 11 a.m. And, another time, I don't remember why, but I didn't need or want it. But, San Diego is beautiful and this hotel has been nice in the past and could be again with a little common sense and care.

Reviews.Title: “Good business hotel”
Reviews.Author: travelmavendiva
Reviews.Content: Stayed here a few times on business over past few months, culminating in a 10 day stay in June. The staff is accomodating and friendly, especially front desk staff, and concierge lounge staff - delightful and friendly....having to spend such a long time away from home, yet having convenient place for breakfast made this tolerable, especially when working long hours. Parking can be tricky. There were two large meetings, conventions while there but this was not disturbing, handled efficiently by staff. Room always cleaned on time and kept immaculate.

Reviews.Title: “BAD experience!!!”
Reviews.Author: brebaker
Reviews.Content: I stayed here and somebody hit my car (the valet). And then never reported it. In the morning, the told me to come in for a complimentary breakfast and when I got up to leave, they actually mad me pay for one of them, AT A BUFFETT!! Everything about the trip was horrible

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Experience”
Reviews.Author: Anonymous060
Reviews.Content: The staff at this hotel could not have been more helpful and attentive. I stayed here for my wedding in San Diego, and everyone was wonderful. The hotel is beautiful, I believe it is recently remodeled. However, it was the staff that really made it great. They were accomodating and professional. I will definitely stay here again and highly recommend it to anyone visiting San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous setting for work or leisure!”
Reviews.Author: Malphaba
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 5 days, for a conference, but also made some vacation time out of it. Overall the experience was very pleasant. I’ll get the negative parts over with first, but there weren’t that many to be honest. The first difficulty I experienced was not the fault of the hotel exactly. I requested a refrigerator when I made my reservations (which was several months before the conference). Granted, due to the medical condition of the conferences, over 100 people needed fridges, but being a Marriott’s Member and making my reservations so far in advance, I should’ve been guaranteed one. They were pretty accommodating when I was not able to get one, but it definitely made a lot more stress for me during my trip having to go out of my way to get my medication from the industrial KITCHEN fridge every day. I did receive one, when one became available, but only after requesting one several times and being quite “assertive.” Another small thing that I found quite bothersome was that every morning, starting at around 7:00 a.m. there would be a whistling/screaming sound in the bathroom. I’m not sure if it had something to do with the air circulation or plumbing but was definitely irritating when I had a couple more hours to sleep, or was trying to get ready for the day. Beyond those things though- this hotel was really great! The beds were extremely comfortable, and the pool area was immaculate and beautiful! I spend every free second poolside! The restaurant was a little pricey. It was $13 for the breakfast buffet of bagels, muffins etc, all of which you had to toast yourself. It ended up being easier to just sit down and specifically order what you wanted. The food was delicious though and the staff was tremendously pleasant and helpful. At one point, we were a little late for our provided breakfast and some of the items had already been removed but they replenished them and found us, to tell us they were back! Amazing customer service! This hotel is also in a great location near a trolley station that will take you to anywhere you could want to go in San Diego! Overall I was very impressed and would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Hard to Find”
Reviews.Author: adoraoo7
Reviews.Content: The hotel was really nice but trying to get to it was tricky. The directions we had and the location of the hotel was tricky. It took us about 30 mins or more driving around the area to finally find it. And we found it on mistake. After driving around and around we stopped for food right near it and as we drove out of the lot we happened to find the street! Besides trying to find it, the hotel is nice and clean, I would stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Not the newest hotel, but we liked it better every day.”
Reviews.Author: RedFoxNewEngland
Reviews.Content: Not the newest hotel, but we liked it better every day. Very good near gourmet in-hotel restaurant, and helpful, competent hotel staff. Exhibited at a small trade show in hotel, and didn't have any problems with materials being at right place at the right time. Staff was helpful, including lifting one or two heavy things into place. Location is good if you are on business. Nearby highway and about 20-30 minutes to airport. Large shopping centers within walking distance. Didn't need a rental car as light rail station was close by. This worked very well for us on our day off. Only negative is that jacuzzi is outside, and it does get cold and rainy in San Diego in January.

Reviews.Title: “Nickel and dimed for average service”
Reviews.Author: SendMeSeattle
Reviews.Content: It's not like the hotel room is a deal in the first place at a price over $200, but you can look forward to paying for self parking for $13 a day in a small lot that is difficult to fit anything but a compact car. If you would like to use the internet in your room you will be paying an additional $10 a day and if you need wireless you can find it in the lobby for an additional $10 per day even if you already paid for internet access in your room. I was told that they are a full service hotel and wanted to keep the internet connections fast so they could not possible make it open access. I guess they have never heard of a password or time limited access model. There is no complementary breakfast offered and no restaurants that are nearby. The hotel is surrounded by offices and empty parking lots. This hotel is like a bad first date. The outward appearances look good but no substance. The pool was cold, much like my French fries I received from room service. The staff was friendly, except for the women working in the restaurant coffee bar that told me she didn't know how to make any of the complicated drinks like a latte. The rooms were small, especially the counter area near the sink but had nice soaps and lotions. You have many options in beautiful San Diego stay some where else.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place”
Reviews.Author: EBRJ
Reviews.Content: Stayed here May 25 and 26, 2007. My stay was pleasant and the hotel comfortable. It was an easy drive to the airport. Would recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Need a car...”
Reviews.Author: otsthedog
Reviews.Content: Definitely not in the heart of San Diego. Like most of California's car culture, it helps to have one here. Cabs were not plentiful making getting around difficult. The trolley was just a short walk away. The ATM was broken the first day I was there, so I didn't have the cash to use the trolley (which was getting set to accept credit cards - but as yet didn't). The bartender took $5 out of his tip jar and lent it to me so that I could use the trolley. Of course, I paid him back and tipped him well the next day - but, it was still very nice of him. Rooms were typical for what one would expect of a Marriott. The pool was always crowded. Although there were hammocks around in the shade that were unoccupied on occasion. Conference facilities were fine. Again, typical for what one would expect. The trolley provided easy access to the YMCA (2 or 3 stops down) as well as to City Center.

Reviews.Title: “one noisy room”
Reviews.Author: oldhippiegal
Reviews.Content: Room 202 there were intermitent, irregular spells of a rumbling with a screeching noise that sounded like someone drilling into masonry on the other side of the bathroom wall. The room is next to the elevator shaft and it seemed to happen every time the right-hand east elevator moved. Maybe there is a bearing that is worn or some other need for maintenance on the elevator. At 10pm I called and said this was going to make it hard for me to sleep, and they said the whole hotel was booked up, but they offered me a voucher for free breakfast. I called again at 11pm and asked if they could find me a room in town at any of their affiliated hotels, and they said they had just then had a cancellation, so they gave me a new room. That room (1515) was fine, and a little larger too. Bed was comfortable, nice variety of pillows. There was audible snoring noise coming through the door that connects two rooms, but since that was muffled and ongoing, I slept fine. My dog at home snores softly too. So if you get booked into 202, or any room above it (302, 402, etc), listen for a long time and see if this noise shows up.

Reviews.Title: “really pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: europe2006
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Marriott in Mission Valley last weekend. The hotel is beautiful, and the service was great. The room was clean and the bed was amazing. One of the best Hotel beds, I have ever slept in. The pool looked fabulous, I only wished I had a couple of more days to enjoy it.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient, clean, comfortable”
Reviews.Author: pytrash
Reviews.Content: Stayed here from 7/6 - 7/8. I booked this through Priceline for $80/night, most sites were asking $180/night, so no complains there. The whole hotel is non-smoking so that's good for me, no need to request a non-smoking room. I didn't specify a King bed, and we got two double beds room. I didn't bother to switch to another room, as we are facing the pool and in the middle of the building, the view was quite nice from the balcony. We didn't park in their parking lot either, as I've read the $13/day charge. Lucky that most people like to park in the hotel, so we got a spot on the street every day. I believed the distance to the parking lot vs to my spot on the street is about the same. It's less than a minute walk from car to lobby. Hotel staff were very polite. The trolley station is just a block away and quite convenient. We took the trolley to Old Town, Gaslamp Qtr, Balboa Park without any problem. The beds are quite comfortable. The bathroom size is ok, sink area is outside the bathroom. The closet is not that big, but we didn't use it either, coz it smells.
